items.title: Henslowe explains the business of software development
items.content_html:
Henslowe: Mr. Fennyman, allow me to explain about the software business. The natural condition is one of insurmountable obstacles on the road to imminent disaster.

Fennyman: So what do we do?

Henslowe: Nothing. Strangely enough, it all turns out well.

Fennyman: How?

Henslowe: I don‚Äôt know. It‚Äôs a mystery.
‚ÄúSpring‚Äù

items.title: Word of the day - Licentious
items.content_html:
Reading this morning I came upon this word, licentious.

Licentious - adjective

  1. Lacking moral discipline or ignoring legal restraint, especially in sexual conduct.
  2. Having no regard for accepted rules or standards.

And it became my word of the day.
If there were an Oscar for sleeping I‚Äôm pretty sure I could take the Best Side Sleep - Man On A Couch Category.
My first born is going to see Hamilton tonight. There‚Äôll be no living with miss ‚ÄúYoung Hungry & Scrappy‚Äù after this. üá∫üá∏

items.title: The Mac Daddy
items.content_html:
I‚Äôm experimenting now with the phone app. Here I‚Äôm adding five photos to show how I made a Mac Daddy pizza. I‚Äôm curious if I can add them here and edit the post and place text between them later. In other words, how do multiple photos get organized in a single post and how can the author organize them if at all? It‚Äôs an interesting trying to communicate with words and photos. It shows how the platform can impact the writing. Support for photos sounds easy at first, but support for multiple photos leads interesting design decisions both for the platform and the user.

I‚Äôm not sure what right answer is when it comes to placement so this is a way of discovering how we can use micro.blog through the clever use of food porn.

Awesome! So after you post multiple photos through the phone app, you can then edit the post on the web to interject prose inline, that is fantastic. So what is a Mac Daddy?

It begins by getting a plain take and bake cheese pizza, browning about 3/4 pound of ground beef, and then sprinkling that throughout the cheese. I also add slices of onion. Bake at 425 for 10 minutes.

While the pie is baking, remove the core from an iceberg lettuce‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶and chop that sucker up.

When the pie is done baking, use Thousand Island dressing to make a nice swirl of yumminess throughout the cheesy beefy oniony crust. Then distribute the lettuce and add chopped tomatoes to your liking. Add another swirl of Thousand Island to finish it off.

The end result is the Mac Daddy. So named because it tastes like a better version of a Big Mac. It‚Äôs kid tested and perfect for movie nights. Now, wasn‚Äôt this a fun way to see what you can do with muliple photos in a single post on micro.blog?

items.title: Replacing the Battery in an Early 2013 MacBook Pro - End
items.content_html:
At the end of the second Ghostbusters movie Rick Moranis‚Äôs character Louis Tully has acquired a portable cyclotron and has been dutifully blasting away at the slime barrier around the museum when it finally explodes and frees the rest of the gang. At one point someone turns and goes, ‚ÄúHey, you‚Äôre a Ghostbuster!‚Äù And he just stands there nodding his head in this excited little way and goes, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a Ghostbuster!‚Äù That is the feeling you get when you pull something like this off. The other bit that was exciting about doing this is actually breaking the equivalent of the 4th Wall and peering into the box itself. I don‚Äôt miss PCs, but I do lament the fact that with mobile computing we rarely if ever get into the machine anymore. I suppose it‚Äôs not unlike old gear heads lamenting the fact that they can‚Äôt turn newer cars into hot rods. The fact is we‚Äôre becoming more removed from the very thing that makes software possible, but that is where it lives, right there, in the shot below.

The new battery is in its place and 5 years of dust & cruftage has been dutifully blown out of the chassis. I guess I‚Äôm a computer repairman now‚Ä¶
This is close up of the battery connector socket after securing the battery board with two Torx screws.
